about.title: About
about.paragraphOne: Spot in is a platform that allows you to share your favorite spots with the world. You can create a spot by providing a name, a description, and a website target. You can also provide the latitude and longitude of the spot to display it on a map.

login.title: Login
login.description: Login to your Spot in account.

logout.title: Logout
logout.description: Logout from your Spot in account.
logout.paragraphOne: You have been successfully logged out.

register.title: Register
register.description: Create a new Spot in account.

username.label: Username
username.warning: The username will be public for all users.

resetPassword.title: Reset password
resetPassword.description: Reset your Spot in account password.

resetPasswordRequest.title: Request password reset
resetPasswordRequest.description: Request a password reset for your Spot in account.

footer.offeredBy: A service offered by Spot in.

index.title: Homepage
index.subtitle: The Internet of places
index.paragraphOne: Spot inÂ® is the missing link between the physical space and the hidden treasures of information in the digital world. At the heart of the Internet of places, this platform transforms every place, every 'spot', into an open-air gallery. Explore, document, discover, learn and be amazed! We power the link, you the content.

notFound.title: Not Found
notFound.description: The requested page could not be found.
notFound.paragraphOne: This may be due to the following reasons: the spot or profile has been deliberately deleted or the QR code is invalid (degradation, incorrect configuration, etc.).
notFound.latestSpotsDescription: You can find the other spots available on the
notFound.registerPageDescription: To create your own spots, create an account on the
notFound.homePageDescription: To find out more about Spot in, visit

configure.title: Configure spot
configure.paragraphOne: You can configure this spot once. After that, it will be locked and no one else can configure it.

index.title: Your spots
index.paragraphOne: Spots can take place in the virtual or in the physical world. They capture the context and the circumstances that form the setting for an event.
index.name: Name

redirect.title: Redirection page
redirect.description: The redirection page of the spot.
redirect.spotScanned: You just have scanned a spot!
redirect.spotExplanation:
{spotIn} adds digital information to our physical world with the help of 'spots'.
Share spots with your friends and discover new places and things!

details.part1: Spots marked with a checkmark ({icon}) are created by certified users or administrators. This means that the user has been verified by the platform and is considered trustworthy.
details.part2: Spots marked with an exclamation mark ({icon}) are created by unverified users. This means that the user has not been verified by the platform and may not be trustworthy. Please use caution when interacting with these spots.

modal.title: You are about to leave Spot in
modal.details: You are about to leave Spot in and visit {websiteTarget}. Please use caution when interacting with this external content. To access this content, click on the button below.

name.label: Name
name.placeholder: Enter the name of your spot

description.label: Spot description
description.placeholder: Enter the description of your spot

latitude.label: Spot latitude (between -90.0 and 90.0)
latitude.placeholder: Enter the latitude of your spot (e.g. 46.818188)

longitude.label: Spot longitude (between -180.0 and 180.0)
longitude.placeholder: Enter the longitude of your spot (e.g. 8.227511)

websiteTarget.label: Website target
websiteTarget.placeholder: Enter the target of your spot (e.g. https://www.example.com)

configured.label: Configured
configured.note: If set to "No", another user can configure this spot once.

public.label: Public
public.note: If the spot is public, it will be visible to all users.

optionsForAdvancedUsers.label: Options for advanced users
optionsForAdvancedUsers.note: These options are for advanced users.

payload.label: Payload
payload.placeholder: Enter the payload of your spot in JSON format (e.g. {"hello": "world"})
payload.note: The payload must be a valid JSON object. Refer to the API documentation for more details.

directAccessToWebsiteTarget.label: Direct access to website target
directAccessToWebsiteTarget.note: If set to "Yes", the user will be redirected to the website target when scanning the spot. If set to "No", the user will be redirected to the spot's redirection page.

index.title: Your tokens
index.paragraphOne: The tokens enable you to publish/manage spots from other platform with a REST API. The API documentation is available at the following link:
index.name: Name

name.label: Token name
name.placeholder: Enter the name of your token

value.label: Token value
value.placeholder: The value of your token will be generated automatically
value.note: Once the token is created, you will not be able to see the value again. Save it in a secure place.

index.title: Users
index.paragraphOne: Manage the users of the platform. You can create, update and delete users.

username.label: Username
username.placeholder: Enter the username of the user

email.label: Email
email.placeholder: Enter the email of the user

password.label: Password
password.placeholder: Enter the password of the user

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.note: If the user is not enabled, they will not be able to log in.
